Pseudo-Terminal Encoded Terminal Modes
registry.note: opcode and argument values which make up the "encoded terminal modes" values

record.description: Interrupt character; 255 if none. Similarly for the other characters. Not all of these characters are supported on all systems.
The quit character (sends SIGQUIT signal on POSIX systems).
Erase the character to left of the cursor.
End-of-file character (sends EOF from the terminal).
End-of-line character in addition to carriage return and/or linefeed.
Erases a word left of cursor.
Enter the next character typed literally, even if it is a special character
Switch to a different shell layer.
Prints system status line (load, command, pid, etc).
Toggles the flushing of terminal output.
The ignore parity flag. The parameter SHOULD be 0 if this flag is FALSE, and 1 if it is TRUE.
Map NL into CR on input.
Map CR to NL on input.
Any char will restart after stop.
Ring bell on input queue full.
Terminal input and output is assumed to be encoded in UTF-8.
Enable input and output of uppercase characters by preceding their lowercase equivalents with "\".
Echo NL even if ECHO is off.
Specifies the input baud rate in bits per second.
Specifies the output baud rate in bits per second.
